Package lazyTrees

Class SuperMarket

  • java.lang.Object
    • lazyTrees.SuperMarket
  • public class SuperMarket
extends java.lang.Object
    Simulates the market scenario of buying and adding items to a store's inventory. Implements BST with lazy deletion to keep track of total inventory ("deleted" + non deleted) and current inventory (non deleted only).

    • Field Summary

      SuperMarket()

    • Constructor Detail

      • SuperMarket

        public SuperMarket()
        Instantiates inventory to be a LazySearchTree of Item objects.

    • Method Detail

      • addToInventory

        public void addToInventory​(java.lang.String item)
        Add a new item with the name as in parameter into inventory. If there is already same name product, increase amount by one, if not create a new object.
        Parameters:
        item - The item to be added to the inventory tree.

      • removeFromInventory

        public void removeFromInventory​(java.lang.String item)
        If the item is in the inventory, decrease the count by one. If only one item is left, remove it from the inventory.
        Parameters:
        item - The item to be removed to the inventory tree.

      • cleanInventory

        public boolean cleanInventory​(java.lang.String message)
        When the soft deleted items reaches the threshold, hard remove them from the tree structure.
        Returns:
        Whether garage collection was successful.

      • showFirstAndLastItem

        public void showFirstAndLastItem​(java.lang.String message)
        Display the first item and last item of the soft tree in lexical order.

      • displayInventoryState

        protected void displayInventoryState​(java.lang.String message,
                                     boolean showTree)
        Shows the state of the tree by displaying: - the *hard* inventory, which includes deleted nodes. - the *soft* inventory, which excludes deleted nodes.
        Parameters:
        message - Additional details about the state.
        showTree - Set to true if we want to display the contents of the tree

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
